title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 August 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
01:24 <szrrizvi> has quit  
01:48 <kstuart> has quit  
06:03 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
07:24 <Denis1> has quit  
07:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <sburjan> has quit  
08:13 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <kstuart> has quit  
09:20 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
11:32 <mflorea> Caused by: org.hibernate.StaleObjectStateException: Row was updated or  deleted by another transaction (or unsaved-value mapping was incorrect):  [com.xpn.xwiki.objects.LargeStringProperty#...  
11:37 <mflorea> I have an user that installed http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/FullCalendar+Application which has a page with jQuery pasted in a JSX object. The import of this page partially failed, with the above exception, as the code property of the JSX is empty and he cannot save or delete that page. Ofc, uninstalling the extension fails.  
11:38 <mflorea> Initially I though the problem was the fact that the value of the code property is too large, but this should trigger a different exception. So it must be something else.  
11:39 <camil7> is this mysql on InnoDB? I remember having a similar problem with mySQL on myISAM tables  
12:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
12:43 <vmassol> has quit  
12:45 <mflorea> has quit  
13:09 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:30 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <sdumitriu> mflorea: That's a low level error  
13:59 <sdumitriu> It usually means that the database already has a different kind of value stored for that property  
14:00 <sdumitriu> It comes from a different definition of the class  
14:00 <mflorea> the thing is just before this StaleObjectStateException, there is an error logged  
14:00 <mflorea> a sec  
14:01 <mflorea> ERROR c.x.xwiki.store.XWikiHibernateStore - No data for property code of object id 1042303781537423122  
14:01 <mflorea> so it's related to the same JSX object  
14:01 <sdumitriu> Hm...  
14:02 <mflorea> 09:29:58 / 09:29:59 so they happen one after another  
14:03 <mflorea> so XWikiHibernateStore#loadXWikiProperty gets a ObjectNotFoundException and logs the first exception  
14:03 <mflorea> s/exception/error  
14:07 <sdumitriu> SQL access could tell us what's wrong  
14:07 <sdumitriu> Do you have that?  
14:07 <mflorea> nop :(  
14:08 <mflorea> and they have InnoDB  
14:08 <mflorea> if that matters  
14:12 <polx> Hello XWikiers, is there a simple feature I can activate on an xwiki 5.0 so that user's public profile (for some) display a form to contact them by email? I sure can implement it but I can't believe it has not been done.  
14:12 <polx> Also, I am looking at a scrambled display (source-scrambled, user-visible).  
14:30 <camil7> poix: the current obfuscation of the users email is in the XWiki.XWikiUsers  class  
14:30 <camil7> you can replace it by your own implementation there  
14:30 <camil7> just go to the class editor and open the email property  
14:32 <camil7> (At least it was there last time I checked .... in 5.0.3 .... long ago ;)  
14:33 <polx> Thanks @camil7.  
14:33 <polx> So no module that has a contact form? That's impressive.  
14:34 <camil7> I just did not remember about that  
14:54 <sburjan> polx: afaik no, we don't have that. at least not on the default distribution. maybe ther is an extension  
14:54 <sburjan> if not, you'll have to contribute one  
15:00 <polx> I'll have to.
